about.summary: A common task faced by researchers is the creation of APA style (i.e., American Psychological Association style) tables from statistical output. In R a large number of function calls are often needed to obtain all of the desired information for a single APA style table. As well, the process of manually creating APA style tables in a word processor is prone to transcription errors. This package creates Word files (.doc files) containing APA style tables for several types of analyses. Using this package minimizes transcription errors and reduces the number commands needed by the user.

A common task faced by researchers is the creation of APA style (i.e., American Psychological Association style) tables from statistical output. In R a large number of function calls are often needed to obtain all of the desired information for a single APA style table. As well, the process of manually creating APA style tables in a word processor is prone to transcription errors. This package creates Word files (.doc files) containing APA style tables for several types of analyses. Using this package minimizes transcription errors and reduces the number commands needed by the user.

name: r-apatables
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "2.0.8" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-apatables
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/apaTables_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/apaTables/apaTables_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 6d8712f01c8b2ddbe4ef77096cf44b0ac3e7bb1bcf430ca39c18ef983ee8c64b

build:
  number: 4
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-mbess
    - r-boot
    - r-broom
    - r-car
    - r-dplyr
    - r-tibble
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-mbess
    - r-boot
    - r-broom
    - r-car
    - r-dplyr
    - r-tibble

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('apaTables')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('apaTables')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/dstanley4/apaTables
  license: MIT
  summary: A common task faced by researchers is the creation of APA style (i.e., American Psychological Association style) tables from statistical output. In R a large number of function calls are often needed to obtain all of the desired information for a single APA style table. As well, the process of manually creating
    APA style tables in a word processor is prone to transcription errors. This package creates Word files (.doc files) containing APA style tables for several types of analyses. Using this package minimizes transcription errors and reduces the number commands needed by the user.
  license_family: MIT
  license_file:
    - LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
